com.soikea.commitment2050.api

Class CommitmentApi

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.ws.rs.core.Application
      • com.soikea.commitment2050.api.CommitmentApi

  • @ApplicationPath(value="/commitmentapi")
public class CommitmentApi
extends javax.ws.rs.core.Application
    This is the REST API documentation for commitments. Here you will find information of how to invoke the REST API and what you can expect as return values.

      • addOrUpdateCommitment

        @POST
 @Path(value="/commitments")
 @Consumes(value="application/json")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response addOrUpdateCommitment(Commitment commitment)
        Add or update commitment. If commitment has id then tries to find equivalent article and if found updates it (if allowed). If commitment does not have id or id does not match in any existing article then creates new article.
        Parameters:
        commitment - Commitment
        Returns:
        commitment @see Commitment

      • sendEmailNotify

        @POST
 @Path(value="/sendemailnotify")
 @Consumes(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response sendEmailNotify(Commitment commitment)
        Send email notify about created or updated commitment Note! commitment must have id (ie. save commitment first, so that Liferay generates articleId before calling this)
        Parameters:
        commitment - commitment
        Returns:
        commitment @see Commitment

        Add report. Report's commitmentArticleId must be given.
        Parameters:

      • searchCommitments

        @GET
 @Path(value="/commitments")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response searchCommitments(@QueryParam(value="keywords")
                                                                                                                          java.lang.String keywords,
                                                                                                                          @QueryParam(value="categoryIds")
                                                                                                                          java.util.List<java.lang.Long> categoryIds,
                                                                                                                          @QueryParam(value="language")
                                                                                                                          java.lang.String language,
                                                                                                                          @QueryParam(value="organization")
                                                                                                                          java.lang.String organization,
                                                                                                                          @QueryParam(value="start")
                                                                                                                          java.lang.Integer start,
                                                                                                                          @QueryParam(value="end")
                                                                                                                          java.lang.Integer end,
                                                                                                                          @QueryParam(value="sort")
                                                                                                                          java.lang.String sort)
        Search commitments - Searches only articles which structure is commitment, key: 31796 - if categoryids does not contain any commitmenttype categories, then all (currently 3 will be added: nutrition, greendeal, commitment) will be added to search terms. If at least one is given, then searh limits to only that commitmentype. - if language is empty, defaults to fi_FI - if organization name is given, search should only return commitments which organization name matches exactly query param. However, this feature is still experimental and might need changes - list can be sorted with sort parameter - list can be paginated with start and end parameters Results are generated by Liferays search engine, which returns very limited list of indexed values. These are not transformed to actual commitment model, because it would be very time consuming operation and thus generate performance issues. Returned values are roughly (in addition Liferay might add a few more fields which are not here mentioned ): "articleId", "title_" + language, "assetCategoryIds", "expando__keyword__custom_fields__Organization name", "expando__custom_fields__creatorUserName", "expando__keyword__custom_fields__creatorUserId", "status", "createdDate", "priority", "expando__keyword__custom_fields__creatorPortrait", "expando__keyword__custom_fields__organizationLogo"
        Parameters:
        keywords - search string
        categoryIds - List of Category ids
        organization - Organization name, if given, query should return only commitments which organization name matches exactly to query param
        language - if empty, defaults to fi_FI
        start - start index (pagination)
        end - end index (pagination)
        sort, - @see CommitmentSort enum for values
        Returns:
        List of commitment search results. Results are generated by Liferays search engine, which returns very limited list of indexed values and thus performs well.

      • joinToParentCommitment

        @POST
 @Path(value="/commitments/jointoparent")
 @Consumes(value="multipart/form-data")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response joinToParentCommitment(@FormParam(value="parentCommitmentId")
                                                                                                                                                                                     java.lang.String parentCommitmentId,
                                                                                                                                                                                     @FormParam(value="childCommitmentId")
                                                                                                                                                                                     java.lang.String childCommitmentId)
        Add child article to parent article relationship. User has to be logged in and rights to edit childcommitment Child commitment (article) must exists before calling this. Updates parent commitment priority
        Parameters:
        parentCommitmentId - parent commitment id (articleId)
        childCommitmentId - child commitment id (articleId)
        Returns:
        Response ok if successfull

      • getReports

        @GET
 @Path(value="/commitments/{commitmentid}/{operationid}/reports")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getReports(@PathParam(value="commitmentid")
                                                                                                                                                        java.lang.String commitmentId,
                                                                                                                                                        @PathParam(value="operationid")
                                                                                                                                                        java.lang.String operationid)
        Get commitment operation reports (Generic method, this can be used if folder id is known but api does not support specific search)
        Parameters:
        commitmentId - commitment id
        operationid - operation id
        Returns:
        List of Reports Report

      • updateCommitmentImage

        @POST
 @Path(value="/image")
 @Consumes(value="application/json")
 @Produces(value="text/plain")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response updateCommitmentImage(CommitmentImage commitmentImage)
        Add commitment image to Liferay's document library, folder: "Sitoumusten kuvat" If successfully added return relative url to image filename must be given (and perhaps mut be unique... or else Liferay errors with duplicate file entry message...) image data should be base64 encoded image mimetype must be given
        Parameters:
        commitmentImage - Commitment image @see CommitmentImage
        Returns:
        Response, relative url to image if added successfully
